summary: New characters: Stefan Trofimovich Miusov, Father Iosif, Mikhailovitch Miusov, Pavel Smerdyakov. New connections: Ivan–Stefan (intellectual peers), Father–Ivan (professional acquaintance), Father–Zosima (colleagues), Ivan–Mikhail (discussants) and 2 more.
summary_short: Introduces Stefan Trofimovich Miusov, Father Iosif, Mikhailovitch Miusov and Pavel Smerdyakov. Alyosha Karamazov is the most connected figure (21 ties). Key relationship types: discussants, intellectual peers.
highlights: Most central: Alyosha Karamazov (21), Fyodor Karamazov (17), Ivan Karamazov (14), Zosima Fyodorovich Karamazov (14)
Key ties: Ivan–Stefan (intellectual peers), Father–Ivan (professional acquaintance), Father–Zosima (colleagues), Ivan–Mikhail (discussants), +2 more
New characters: Stefan, Father, Mikhailovitch, Pavel
story_summary: Father Zossima returns to find the guests engaged in a heated discussion about Ivan's article on Church and State jurisdiction. Ivan argues that the Church should ultimately encompass the State, transforming society into a Christian Church that reforms criminals through conscience rather than punishment. Miüsov expresses skepticism and recounts an anecdote about socialist Christians being feared, just as Dmitri Fyodorovitch unexpectedly arrives.
evidence_quotes: Ivan...maintain[s] that the Church ought to include the whole State
Dmitri Fyodorovitch, came in...his sudden appearance caused some surprise
